page.title: 17Ratcliffe Culey Church
page.content:
All Saints' Church in Ratcliffe Culey, seven hundred years old, has just lost its two bells.
They had not been rung for the last 25 years, and during that time the wooden mountings have deteriorated so badly that the bells have had to be brought down. This was done as part of restoration work on the church by the local council's "community programme", which is supported by the government.
There is some interesting mediaeval stained-glass in the chancel windows, including the picture of an owl.
Usually quiet, once every two years the church is filled by the children of Witherley Primary School and their parents for their Carol Service.
